definition: history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.chinese: 從那時起，我們的羅曼史開始了。

sentences.english: To dream of jasmine means a romance is in the offing.
sentences.chinese: 夢見茉莉花意着一段羅曼史將至。

sentences.english: Like a romance, a neck can go wrong in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 如同羅曼史一般，脖子變形也有許多不同的原因。

sentences.english: There's a romance between two soldiers.
Ellison's most notorious romance ended up in court.
sentences.chinese: 埃裏森最爲聲名狼藉的羅曼史終結於法庭。

sentences.english: I think a new romance will rev you up in the future.
sentences.chinese: 我看不久的將來，新的羅曼史會使你雀躍不已。

sentences.english: The novel which, raunchily, redrew the map of women's romance.
sentences.chinese: 這部小說差勁地刷新了女性羅曼史的版圖。

definition: to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
to make a concession/to be accommodating
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
